main event: A ball of flame was observed breaking up or exploding, lasting less than 3 seconds, believed to be a falling satellite or meteorite.
interesting points: The object was described as a ball of flame breaking up or exploding, which lasted less than 3 seconds.
The observer initially believed the object to be a falling satellite or meteorite until it completely extinguished.
The object was observed from the ground near Crossville, Tennessee.
The observer described the object as having a glow all over it and seeing lights on the side, with a size of about 30 to 40 feet in diameter.
sighted object: Ball of flame breaking up or exploding
